required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Residual Symptoms After Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) in Lithuanian Population
clinical_study.official_title: Residual Symptoms in Patients With a History of Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) and Their Impact on Biopsychosocial Functions (Post-Covid Syndrome)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to describe the post-covid-19 syndrome in Lithuanian population regarding the remaining symptoms and their impact on physical functioning, work ability and needs of rehabilitation.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants with suspected and confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection will complete an anonymous online questionnaire for post-covid syndrome, i.e. symptoms lasting longer than 28 days after post-covid-19 syndrome. The online survey is developed to assess the health state before infection and residual symptoms lasting longer than acute COVID-19 infection, influencing the functional activity and work ability. The needs of rehabilitation will also be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Description of post-covid-19 syndrome in Lithuanian population
primary_outcome.description: Post-covid-19 syndrome in Lithuanian population: prevalence, symptomatology and needs of rehabilitation

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of medical premorbid status in post-covid-19 syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: The severity of comorbidities in terms of self-reported medical diagnoses and medication

study_pop.textblock: The online study will be open to all volunteers over the age of 18 with COVID-19 infection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- older than 18 years age patients;
- a history of COVID-19 infection that was and was not positive for SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic or antibody testing
- the duration of remaining symptoms is longer than 28 days
- ability to fulfil internet-based questionnaire
Exclusion Criteria:
- ongoing covid-19 infection
- other comorbidities requiring treatment or rehabilitation
